user.description: Setup your Better Thermostat to integrate with Home Assistant

data.name: Name*
data.off_temperature: The outdoor temperature when the thermostat turns off
data.window_off_delay: Delay before the thermostat turns off when the window is open and back on when the window is closed
data.outdoor_sensor: If you have an outdoor sensor, you can use it to get the outdoor temperature
data.valve_maintenance: If your thermostat has no own maintenance mode, you can use this one
data.local_calibration: The local calibration entity of your thermostat
data.weather: Your weather entity to get the outdoor temperature
data.calibration_round: Should the calibration be rounded to the nearest
data.heat_auto_swapped: If the auto means heat for your TRV and you want to swap it (for Google Home users)
data.child_lock: Ignore all inputs on the TRV like a child lock

confirm.title: Confirm adding a Better Thermostat
confirm.description:
You are about to add `{name}` to Home Assistant.
With {trv} as the real Thermostat
and calibration mode: {calibration_mode}

**If you need more info: https://bt.t-haber.de/setup**

error.no_off_mode:
You device is very special and has no off mode :(
It work anyway, but you have to create an automation to fit your specials based on the device events

abort.single_instance_allowed: Only a single Better Thermostat for each real one is allowed.
abort.no_devices_found: No thermostat entity found, make sure you have a climate entity in your Home Assistant
